findings.title: Design Flaw in cUSD Token
findings.description: When the reserve in the Coin98DollarMintBurn contract is insufficient, users cannot burn $cUSD to swap the asset token back.

findings.title: Centralized Control of State Variable
findings.description: The controlling authorities can change critical state variables to gain additional profit, which is unfair to other users.

findings.title: Incorrect Daily Total Mint and Burn Amount Update
findings.description: The currentTotalMintedToday or currentTotalBurnedToday value does not reset to zero due to incorrect total mint / burn amount updates when the time has passed for LIMIT_TIME hours (24 hours by default) since the first mint / burn of the day, preventing users from minting / burning $cUSD for the expected amount.

findings.title: Division Before Multiplication
findings.description: The rounding error can cause the amountToBurn to be slightly miscalculated due to division before multiplication.

findings.title: Insufficient Logging for Privileged Functions
findings.description: Privileged functions that are executable by the controlling parties are not logged properly by emitting events.

findings.title: Improper Function Visibility
findings.description: Public functions that are never called internally by the contract itself should have external visibility to improve readability and allow clear distinction between externally used and internally called functions.
